31.verse: So that the crowd was amazed when they saw the dumb speaking, the maimed made whole, the lame walking, and the blind seeing; and they recognized and praised and thanked and glorified the God of Israel.

32.verse: Then Jesus called His disciples to Him and said, I have pity and sympathy and am deeply moved for the crowd, because they have been with Me now three days and they have nothing [at all left] to eat; and I am not willing to send them away hungry, lest they faint or become exhausted on the way.

33.verse: And the disciples said to Him, Where are we to get bread sufficient to feed so great a crowd in this isolated and desert place?

34.verse: And Jesus asked them, How many loaves of bread do you have? They replied, Seven, and a few small fish.

35.verse: And ordering the crowd to recline on the ground,

36.verse: He took the seven loaves and the fish, and when He had given thanks, He broke them and gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the people.

37.verse: And they all ate and were satisfied. And they gathered up seven [large provision] baskets full of the broken pieces that were left over.

38.verse: Those who ate were 4,000 men, not including the women and the children.

39.verse: Then He dismissed the crowds, got into the boat, and went to the district of Magadan.

1.verse: NOW THE Pharisees and Sadducees came up to Jesus, and they asked Him to show them a sign (spectacular miracle) from heaven [attesting His divine authority].

2.verse: He replied to them, When it is evening you say, It will be fair weather, for the sky is red,

3.verse: And in the morning, It will be stormy today, for the sky is red and has a gloomy and threatening look. You know how to interpret the appearance of the sky, but you cannot interpret the signs of the times.

4.verse: A wicked and morally unfaithful generation craves a sign, but no sign shall be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah. Then He left them and went away.

5.verse: When the disciples reached the other side of the sea, they found that they had forgotten to bring any bread.

6.verse: Jesus said to them, Be careful and on your guard against the leaven (ferment) of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

7.verse: And they reasoned among themselves about it, saying, It is because we did not bring any bread.

8.verse: But Jesus, aware of this, asked, Why are you discussing among yourselves the fact that you have no bread? O you [men, how little trust you have in Me, how] little faith!

9.verse: Do you not yet discern (perceive and understand)? Do you not remember the five loaves of the five thousand, and how many [small hand] baskets you gathered?

10.verse: Nor the seven loaves for the four thousand, and how many [large provision] baskets you took up?

11.verse: How is it that you fail to understand that I was not talking to you about bread? But beware of the leaven (ferment) of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

12.verse: Then they discerned that He did not tell them to beware of the leaven of bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

13.verse: Now when Jesus went into the region of Caesarea Philippi, He asked His disciples, Who do people say that the Son of Man is?

14.verse: And they answered, Some say John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.

15.verse: He said to them, But who do you [yourselves] say that I am?

16.verse: Simon Peter replied, You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.

17.verse: Then Jesus answered him, Blessed (happy, fortunate, and to be envied) are you, Simon Bar-Jonah. For flesh and blood [men] have not revealed this to you, but My Father Who is in heaven.

18.verse: And I tell you, you are Peter [Greek, Petros--a large piece of rock], and on this rock [Greek, petra--a huge rock like Gibraltar] I will build My church, and the gates of Hades (the powers of the infernal region) shall not overpower it [or be strong to its detriment or hold out against it].

19.verse: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven; and whatever you bind (declare to be improper and unlawful) on earth must be what is already bound in heaven; and whatever you loose (declare lawful) on earth must be what is already loosed in heaven.

20.verse: Then He sternly and strictly charged and warned the disciples to tell no one that He was Jesus the Christ.

21.verse: From that time forth Jesus began [clearly] to show His disciples that He must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things at the hands of the elders and the high priests and scribes, and be killed, and on the third day be raised from death.

22.verse: Then Peter took Him aside to speak to Him privately and began to reprove and charge Him sharply, saying, God forbid, Lord! This must never happen to You!

23.verse: But Jesus turned away from Peter and said to him, Get behind Me, Satan! You are in My way [an offense and a hindrance and a snare to Me]; for you are minding what partakes not of the nature and quality of God, but of men.

24.verse: Then Jesus said to His disciples, If anyone desires to be My disciple, let him deny himself [disregard, lose sight of, and forget himself and his own interests] and take up his cross and follow Me [cleave steadfastly to Me, conform wholly to My example in living and, if need be, in dying, also].

25.verse: For whoever is bent on saving his [temporal] life [his comfort and security here] shall lose it [eternal life]; and whoever loses his life [his comfort and security here] for My sake shall find it [life everlasting].

26.verse: For what will it profit a man if he gains the whole world and forfeits his life [his blessed life in the kingdom of God]? Or what would a man give as an exchange for his [blessed] life [in the kingdom of God]?

27.verse: For the Son of Man is going to come in the glory (majesty, splendor) of His Father with His angels, and then He will render account and reward every man in accordance with what he has done.

28.verse: Truly I tell you, there are some standing here who will not taste death before they see the Son of Man coming in (into) His kingdom.

1.verse: AND SIX days after this, Jesus took with Him Peter and James and John his brother, and led them up on a high mountain by themselves.

2.verse: And His appearance underwent a change in their presence; and His face shone clear and bright like the sun, and His clothing became as white as light.

3.verse: And behold, there appeared to them Moses and Elijah, who kept talking with Him.

4.verse: Then Peter began to speak and said to Jesus, Lord, it is good and delightful that we are here; if You approve, I will put up three booths here--one for You and one for Moses and one for Elijah.

5.verse: While he was still speaking, behold, a shining cloud [composed of light] overshadowed them, and a voice from the cloud said, This is My Son, My Beloved, with Whom I am [and have always been] delighted. Listen to Him!

6.verse: When the disciples heard it, they fell on their faces and were seized with alarm and struck with fear.

7.verse: But Jesus came and touched them and said, Get up, and do not be afraid.

8.verse: And when they raised their eyes, they saw no one but Jesus only.

9.verse: And as they were going down the mountain, Jesus cautioned and commanded them, Do not mention to anyone what you have seen, until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead.

10.verse: The disciples asked Him, Then why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?

11.verse: He replied, Elijah does come and will get everything restored and ready.

12.verse: But I tell you that Elijah has come already, and they did not know or recognize him, but did to him as they liked. So also the Son of Man is going to be treated and suffer at their hands.

13.verse: Then the disciples understood that He spoke to them about John the Baptist.

14.verse: And when they approached the multitude, a man came up to Him, kneeling before Him and saying,

15.verse: Lord, do pity and have mercy on my son, for he has epilepsy (is moonstruck) and he suffers terribly; for frequently he falls into the fire and many times into the water.

16.verse: And I brought him to Your disciples, and they were not able to cure him.

17.verse: And Jesus answered, O you unbelieving (warped, wayward, rebellious) and thoroughly perverse generation! How long am I to remain with you? How long am I to bear with you? Bring him here to Me.

18.verse: And Jesus rebuked the demon, and it came out of him, and the boy was cured instantly.

19.verse: Then the disciples came to Jesus and asked privately, Why could we not drive it out?

20.verse: He said to them, Because of the littleness of your faith [that is, your lack of firmly relying trust]. For truly I say to you, if you have faith [that is living] like a grain of mustard seed, you can say to this mountain, Move from here to yonder place, and it will move; and nothing will be impossible to you.

21.verse: But this kind does not go out except by prayer and fasting.

22.verse: When they were going about here and there in Galilee, Jesus said to them, The Son of Man is going to be turned over into the hands of men.

23.verse: And they will kill Him, and He will be raised [to life] again on the third day. And they were deeply and exceedingly grieved and distressed.

24.verse: When they arrived in Capernaum, the collectors of the half shekel [the temple tax] went up to Peter and said, Does not your Teacher pay the half shekel?

25.verse: He answered, Yes. And when he came home, Jesus spoke to him [about it] first, saying, What do you think, Simon? From whom do earthly rulers collect duties or tribute--from their own sons or from others not of their own family?

26.verse: And when Peter said, From other people not of their own family, Jesus said to him, Then the sons are exempt.

27.verse: However, in order not to give offense and cause them to stumble [that is, to cause them to judge unfavorably and unjustly] go down to the sea and throw in a hook. Take the first fish that comes up, and when you open its mouth you will find there a shekel. Take it and give it to them to pay the temple tax for Me and for yourself.

1.verse: AT THAT time the disciples came up and asked Jesus, Who then is [really] the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?

2.verse: And He called a little child to Himself and put him in the midst of them,

3.verse: And said, Truly I say to you, unless you repent (change, turn about) and become like little children [trusting, lowly, loving, forgiving], you can never enter the kingdom of heaven [at all].

4.verse: Whoever will humble himself therefore and become like this little child [trusting, lowly, loving, forgiving] is greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

5.verse: And whoever receives and accepts and welcomes one little child like this for My sake and in My name receives and accepts and welcomes Me.

6.verse: But whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in and acknowledge and cleave to Me to stumble and sin [that is, who entices him or hinders him in right conduct or thought], it would be better (more expedient and profitable or advantageous) for him to have a great millstone fastened around his neck and to be sunk in the depth of the sea.

7.verse: Woe to the world for such temptations to sin and influences to do wrong! It is necessary that temptations come, but woe to the person on whose account or by whom the temptation comes!

8.verse: And if your hand or your foot causes you to stumble and sin, cut it off and throw it away from you; it is better (more profitable and wholesome) for you to enter life maimed or lame than to have two hands or two feet and be thrown into everlasting fire.

9.verse: And if your eye causes you to stumble and sin, pluck it out and throw it away from you; it is better (more profitable and wholesome) for you to enter life with only one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into the hell (Gehenna) of fire.

10.verse: Beware that you do not despise or feel scornful toward or think little of one of these little ones, for I tell you that in heaven their angels always are in the presence of and look upon the face of My Father Who is in heaven.

11.verse: For the Son of man came to save [from the penalty of eternal death] that which was lost.

12.verse: What do you think? If a man has a hundred sheep, and one of them has gone astray and gets lost, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the mountain and go in search of the one that is lost?

13.verse: And if it should be that he finds it, truly I say to you, he rejoices more over it than over the ninety-nine that did not get lost.

14.verse: Just so it is not the will of My Father Who is in heaven that one of these little ones should be lost and perish.

15.verse: If your brother wrongs you, go and show him his fault, between you and him privately. If he listens to you, you have won back your brother.

16.verse: But if he does not listen, take along with you one or two others, so that every word may be confirmed and upheld by the testimony of two or three witnesses.

17.verse: If he pays no attention to them [refusing to listen and obey], tell it to the church; and if he refuses to listen even to the church, let him be to you as a pagan and a tax collector.

18.verse: Truly I tell you, whatever you forbid and declare to be improper and unlawful on earth must be what is already forbidden in heaven, and whatever you permit and declare proper and lawful on earth must be what is already permitted in heaven.

19.verse: Again I tell you, if two of you on earth agree (harmonize together, make a symphony together) about whatever [anything and everything] they may ask, it will come to pass and be done for them by My Father in heaven.

20.verse: For wherever two or three are gathered (drawn together as My followers) in (into) My name, there I AM in the midst of them.

21.verse: Then Peter came up to Him and said, Lord, how many times may my brother sin against me and I forgive him and let it go? [As many as] up to seven times?

22.verse: Jesus answered him, I tell you, not up to seven times, but seventy times seven!

23.verse: Therefore the kingdom of heaven is like a human king who wished to settle accounts with his attendants.

24.verse: When he began the accounting, one was brought to him who owed him 10,000 talents [probably about $10,000,000],

25.verse: And because he could not pay, his master ordered him to be sold, with his wife and his children and everything that he possessed, and payment to be made.

26.verse: So the attendant fell on his knees, begging him, Have patience with me and I will pay you everything.

27.verse: And his master's heart was moved with compassion, and he released him and forgave him [cancelling] the debt.

28.verse: But that same attendant, as he went out, found one of his fellow attendants who owed him a hundred denarii [about twenty dollars]; and he caught him by the throat and said, Pay what you owe!

29.verse: So his fellow attendant fell down and begged him earnestly, Give me time, and I will pay you all !

30.verse: But he was unwilling, and he went out and had him put in prison till he should pay the debt.

31.verse: When his fellow attendants saw what had happened, they were greatly distressed, and they went and told everything that had taken place to their master.

32.verse: Then his master called him and said to him, You contemptible and wicked attendant! I forgave and cancelled all that [great] debt of yours because you begged me to.

33.verse: And should you not have had pity and mercy on your fellow attendant, as I had pity and mercy on you?

34.verse: And in wrath his master turned him over to the torturers (the jailers), till he should pay all that he owed.

35.verse: So also My heavenly Father will deal with every one of you if you do not freely forgive your brother from your heart his offenses.

1.verse: NOW WHEN Jesus had finished saying these things, He left Galilee and went into the part of Judea that is beyond the Jordan;

2.verse: And great throngs accompanied Him, and He cured them there.

3.verse: And Pharisees came to Him and put Him to the test by asking, Is it lawful and right to dismiss and repudiate and divorce one's wife for any and every cause?

4.verse: He replied, Have you never read that He Who made them from the beginning made them male and female,

5.verse: And said, For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and shall be united firmly (joined inseparably) to his wife, and the two shall become one flesh?

6.verse: So they are no longer two, but one flesh. What therefore God has joined together, let not man put asunder (separate).

7.verse: They said to Him, Why then did Moses command [us] to give a certificate of divorce and thus to dismiss and repudiate a wife?

8.verse: He said to them, Because of the hardness (stubbornness and perversity) of your hearts Moses permitted you to dismiss and repudiate and divorce your wives; but from the beginning it has not been so [ordained].

9.verse: I say to you: whoever dismisses (repudiates, divorces) his wife, except for unchastity, and marries another commits adultery, and he who marries a divorced woman commits adultery.

10.verse: The disciples said to Him, If the case of a man with his wife is like this, it is neither profitable nor advisable to marry.

11.verse: But He said to them, Not all men can accept this saying, but it is for those to whom [the capacity to receive] it has been given.

12.verse: For there are eunuchs who have been born incapable of marriage; and there are eunuchs who have been made so by men; and there are eunuchs who have made themselves incapable of marriage for the sake of the kingdom of heaven. Let him who is able to accept this accept it.

13.verse: Then little children were brought to Jesus, that He might put His hands on them and pray; but the disciples rebuked those who brought them.

14.verse: But He said, Leave the children alone! Allow the little ones to come to Me, and do not forbid or restrain or hinder them, for of such [as these] is the kingdom of heaven composed.

15.verse: And He put His hands upon them, and then went on His way.

16.verse: And behold, there came a man up to Him, saying, Teacher, what excellent and perfectly and essentially good deed must I do to possess eternal life?

17.verse: And He said to him, Why do you ask Me about the perfectly and essentially good? There is only One Who is good [perfectly and essentially]--God. If you would enter into the Life, you must continually keep the commandments.

18.verse: He said to Him, What sort of commandments? [Or, which ones?] And Jesus answered, You shall not kill, You shall not commit adultery, You shall not steal, You shall not bear false witness,

19.verse: Honor your father and your mother, and, You shall love your neighbor as [you do] yourself.

20.verse: The young man said, I have observed all these from my youth; what still do I lack?

21.verse: Jesus answered him, If you would be perfect [that is, have that spiritual maturity which accompanies self-sacrificing character], go and sell what you have and give to the poor, and you will have riches in heaven; and come, be My disciple [side with My party and follow Me].

22.verse: But when the young man heard this, he went away sad (grieved and in much distress), for he had great possessions.

23.verse: And Jesus said to His disciples, Truly I say to you, it will be difficult for a rich man to get into the kingdom of heaven.

24.verse: Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to go into the kingdom of heaven.

25.verse: When the disciples heard this, they were utterly puzzled (astonished, bewildered), saying, Who then can be saved [from eternal death]?

26.verse: But Jesus looked at them and said, With men this is impossible, but all things are possible with God.

27.verse: Then Peter answered Him, saying, Behold, we have left [our] all and have become Your disciples [sided with Your party and followed You]. What then shall we receive?

28.verse: Jesus said to them, Truly I say to you, in the new age [the Messianic rebirth of the world], when the Son of Man shall sit down on the throne of His glory, you who have [become My disciples, sided with My party and] followed Me will also sit on twelve thrones and judge the twelve tribes of Israel.

29.verse: And anyone and everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or lands for My name's sake will receive many [even a hundred] times more and will inherit eternal life.

30.verse: But many who [now] are first will be last [then], and many who [now] are last will be first [then].

1.verse: FOR THE kingdom of heaven is like the owner of an estate who went out in the morning along with the dawn to hire workmen for his vineyard.

2.verse: After agreeing with the laborers for a denarius a day, he sent them into his vineyard.

3.verse: And going out about the third hour (nine o'clock), he saw others standing idle in the marketplace;

4.verse: And he said to them, You go also into the vineyard, and whatever is right I will pay you. And they went.

5.verse: He went out again about the sixth hour (noon), and the ninth hour (three o'clock) he did the same.

6.verse: And about the eleventh hour (five o'clock) he went out and found still others standing around, and said to them, Why do you stand here idle all day?

7.verse: They answered him, Because nobody has hired us. He told them, You go out into the vineyard also and you will get whatever is just and fair.

8.verse: When evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his manager, Call the workmen and pay them their wages, beginning with the last and ending with the first.

9.verse: And those who had been hired at the eleventh hour (five o'clock) came and received a denarius each.

10.verse: Now when the first came, they supposed they would get more, but each of them also received a denarius.

11.verse: And when they received it, they grumbled at the owner of the estate,

12.verse: Saying, These [men] who came last worked no more than an hour, and yet you have made them rank with us who have borne the burden and the scorching heat of the day.

13.verse: But he answered one of them, Friend, I am doing you no injustice. Did you not agree with me for a denarius?

14.verse: Take what belongs to you and go. I choose to give to this man hired last the same as I give to you.

15.verse: Am I not permitted to do what I choose with what is mine? [Or do you begrudge my being generous?] Is your eye evil because I am good?

16.verse: So those who [now] are last will be first [then], and those who [now] are first will be last [then]. For many are called, but few chosen.

17.verse: And as Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, He took the twelve disciples aside along the way and said to them,

18.verse: Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and scribes; and they will sentence Him to death

19.verse: And deliver Him over to the Gentiles to be mocked and whipped and crucified, and He will be raised [to life] on the third day.

20.verse: Then the mother of Zebedee's children came up to Him with her sons and, kneeling, worshiped Him and asked a favor of Him.

21.verse: And He asked her, What do you wish? She answered Him, Give orders that these two sons of mine may sit, one at Your right hand and one at Your left in Your kingdom.

22.verse: But Jesus replied, You do not realize what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I am about to drink and to be baptized with the baptism with which I am baptized ? They answered, We are able.

23.verse: He said to them, You will drink My cup, but seats at My right hand and at My left are not Mine to give, but they are for those for whom they have been ordained and prepared by My Father.

24.verse: But when the ten [other disciples] heard this, they were indignant at the two brothers.

25.verse: And Jesus called them to Him and said, You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their great men hold them in subjection [tyrannizing over them].

26.verse: Not so shall it be among you; but whoever wishes to be great among you must be your servant,

27.verse: And whoever desires to be first among you must be your slave--

28.verse: Just as the Son of Man came not to be waited on but to serve, and to give His life as a ransom for many [the price paid to set them free].

29.verse: And as they were going out of Jericho, a great throng accompanied Him.

30.verse: And behold, two blind men were sitting by the roadside, and when they heard that Jesus was passing by, they cried out, Lord, have pity and mercy on us, [You] Son of David!

31.verse: The crowds reproved them and told them to keep still; but they cried out all the more, Lord, have pity and mercy on us, [You] Son of David!

32.verse: And Jesus stopped and called them, and asked, What do you want Me to do for you?

33.verse: They answered Him, Lord, we want our eyes to be opened!

34.verse: And Jesus, in pity, touched their eyes; and instantly they received their sight and followed Him.

1.verse: AND WHEN they came near Jerusalem and had reached Bethphage at the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two disciples on ahead,

2.verse: Saying to them, Go into the village that is opposite you, and at once you will find a donkey tied, and a colt with her; untie [them] and bring [them] to Me.

3.verse: If anyone says anything to you, you shall reply, The Lord needs them, and he will let them go without delay.

4.verse: This happened that what was spoken by the prophet might be fulfilled, saying,

5.verse: Say to the Daughter of Zion [inhabitants of Jerusalem], Behold, your King is coming to you, lowly and riding on a donkey, and on a colt, the foal of a donkey [a beast of burden].

6.verse: Then the disciples went and did as Jesus had directed them.

7.verse: They brought the donkey and the colt and laid their coats upon them, and He seated Himself on them [the clothing].

8.verse: And most of the crowd kept spreading their garments on the road, and others kept cutting branches from the trees and scattering them on the road.

9.verse: And the crowds that went ahead of Him and those that followed Him kept shouting, Hosanna (O be propitious, graciously inclined) to the Son of David, [the Messiah]! Blessed (praised, glorified) is He Who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna (O be favorably disposed) in the highest [heaven]!

10.verse: And when He entered Jerusalem, all the city became agitated and [trembling with excitement] said, Who is This?

11.verse: And the crowds replied, This is the prophet Jesus from Nazareth of Galilee.

12.verse: And Jesus went into the temple (whole temple enclosure) and drove out all who bought and sold in the sacred place, and He turned over the four-footed tables of the money changers and the chairs of those who sold doves.

13.verse: He said to them, The Scripture says, My house shall be called a house of prayer; but you have made it a den of robbers.

14.verse: And the blind and the lame came to Him in the porches and courts of the temple, and He cured them.

15.verse: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the wonderful things that He did and the boys and the girls and the youths and the maidens crying out in the porches and courts of the temple, Hosanna (O be propitious, graciously inclined) to the Son of David! they were indignant.

16.verse: And they said to Him, Do You hear what these are saying? And Jesus replied to them, Yes; have you never read, Out of the mouths of babes and unweaned infants You have made (provided) perfect praise?

17.verse: And leaving them, He departed from the city and went out to Bethany and lodged there.

18.verse: In the early dawn the next morning, as He was coming back to the city, He was hungry.

19.verse: And as He saw one single leafy fig tree above the roadside, He went to it but He found nothing but leaves on it [seeing that in the fig tree the fruit appears at the same time as the leaves]. And He said to it, Never again shall fruit grow on you! And the fig tree withered up at once.

20.verse: When the disciples saw it, they marveled greatly and asked, How is it that the fig tree has withered away all at once?

21.verse: And Jesus answered them, Truly I say to you, if you have faith (a firm relying trust) and do not doubt, you will not only do what has been done to the fig tree, but even if you say to this mountain, Be taken up and cast into the sea, it will be done.

22.verse: And whatever you ask for in prayer, having faith and [really] believing, you will receive.

23.verse: And when He entered the sacred enclosure of the temple, the chief priests and elders of the people came up to Him as He was teaching and said, By what power of authority are You doing these things, and who gave You this power of authority?

24.verse: Jesus answered them, I also will ask you a question, and if you give Me the answer, then I also will tell you by what power of authority I do these things.

25.verse: The baptism of John--from where was it? From heaven or from men? And they reasoned and argued with one another, If we say, From heaven, He will ask us, Why then did you not believe him?

26.verse: But if we say, From men--we are afraid of and must reckon with the multitude, for they all regard John as a prophet.

27.verse: So they answered Jesus, We do not know. And He said to them, Neither will I tell you by what power of authority I do these things.

28.verse: What do you think? There was a man who had two sons. He came to the first and said, Son, go and work today in the vineyard.

29.verse: And he answered, I will not; but afterward he changed his mind and went.

30.verse: Then the man came to the second and said the same [thing]. And he replied, I will [go], sir; but he did not go.

31.verse: Which of the two did the will of the father? They replied, The first one. Jesus said to them, Truly I tell you, the tax collectors and the harlots will get into the kingdom of heaven before you.

32.verse: For John came to you walking in the way of an upright man in right standing with God, and you did not believe him, but the tax collectors and the harlots did believe him; and you, even when you saw that, did not afterward change your minds and believe him [adhere to, trust in, and rely on what he told you].

33.verse: Listen to another parable: There was a master of a house who planted a vineyard and put a hedge around it and dug a wine vat in it and built a watchtower. Then he let it out [for rent] to tenants and went into another country.

34.verse: When the fruit season drew near, he sent his servants to the tenants to get his [share of the] fruit.

35.verse: But the tenants took his servants and beat one, killed another, and stoned another.

36.verse: Again he sent other servants, more than the first time, and they treated them the same way.

37.verse: Finally he sent his own son to them, saying, They will respect and give heed to my son.

38.verse: But when the tenants saw the son, they said to themselves, This is the heir; come on, let us kill him and have his inheritance.

39.verse: And they took him and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.

40.verse: Now when the owner of the vineyard comes back, what will he do to those tenants?

41.verse: They said to Him, He will put those wretches to a miserable death and rent the vineyard to other tenants of such a character that they will give him the fruits promptly in their season.

42.verse: Jesus asked them, Have you never read in the Scriptures: The very Stone which the builders rejected and threw away has become the Cornerstone; this is the Lord's doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes?

43.verse: I tell you, for this reason the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce the fruits of it.

44.verse: And whoever falls on this Stone will be broken to pieces, but he on whom It falls will be crushed to powder [and It will winnow him, scattering him like dust].

45.verse: And when the chief priests and the Pharisees heard His parables (comparisons, stories used to illustrate and explain), they perceived that He was talking about them.

46.verse: And although they were trying to arrest Him, they feared the throngs because they regarded Him as a prophet.

1.verse: AND AGAIN Jesus spoke to them in parables (comparisons, stories used to illustrate and explain), saying,

2.verse: The kingdom of heaven is like a king who gave a wedding banquet for his son

3.verse: And sent his servants to summon those who had been invited to the wedding banquet, but they refused to come.

4.verse: Again he sent other servants, saying, Tell those who are invited, Behold, I have prepared my banquet; my bullocks and my fat calves are killed, and everything is prepared; come to the wedding feast.

5.verse: But they were not concerned and paid no attention [they ignored and made light of the summons, treating it with contempt] and they went away--one to his farm, another to his business,

6.verse: While the others seized his servants, treated them shamefully, and put them to death.

7.verse: [Hearing this] the king was infuriated; and he sent his soldiers and put those murderers to death and burned their city.

8.verse: Then he said to his servants, The wedding [feast] is prepared, but those invited were not worthy.

9.verse: So go to the thoroughfares where they leave the city [where the main roads and those from the country end] and invite to the wedding feast as many as you find.

10.verse: And those servants went out on the crossroads and got together as many as they found, both bad and good, so [the room in which] the wedding feast [was held] was filled with guests.

11.verse: But when the king came in to view the guests, he looked intently at a man there who had on no wedding garment.

12.verse: And he said, Friend, how did you come in here without putting on the [appropriate] wedding garment? And he was speechless (muzzled, gagged).

13.verse: Then the king said to the attendants, Tie him hand and foot, and throw him into the darkness outside; there will be weeping and grinding of teeth.

14.verse: For many are called (invited and summoned), but few are chosen.

15.verse: Then the Pharisees went and consulted and plotted together how they might entangle Jesus in His talk.

16.verse: And they sent their disciples to Him along with the Herodians, saying, Teacher, we know that You are sincere and what You profess to be and that You teach the way of God truthfully, regardless of consequences and being afraid of no man; for You are impartial and do not regard either the person or the position of anyone.

17.verse: Tell us then what You think about this: Is it lawful to pay tribute [levied on individuals and to be paid yearly] to Caesar or not?

18.verse: But Jesus, aware of their malicious plot, asked, Why do you put Me to the test and try to entrap Me, you pretenders (hypocrites)?

19.verse: Show me the money used for the tribute. And they brought Him a denarius.

20.verse: And Jesus said to them, Whose likeness and title are these?

21.verse: They said, Caesar's. Then He said to them, Pay therefore to Caesar the things that are due to Caesar, and pay to God the things that are due to God.

22.verse: When they heard it they were amazed and marveled; and they left Him and departed.

23.verse: The same day some Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection [of the dead], came to Him and they asked Him a question,

24.verse: Saying, Teacher, Moses said, If a man dies, leaving no children, his brother shall marry the widow and raise up a family for his brother.

25.verse: Now there were seven brothers among us; the first married and died, and, having no children, left his wife to his brother.

26.verse: The second also died childless, and the third, down to the seventh.

27.verse: Last of all, the woman died also.

28.verse: Now, in the resurrection, to which of the seven will she be wife? For they all had her.

29.verse: But Jesus replied to them, You are wrong because you know neither the Scriptures nor God's power.

30.verse: For in the resurrected state neither do [men] marry nor are [women] given in marriage, but they are like the angels in heaven.

31.verse: But as to the resurrection of the dead--have you never read what was said to you by God,

32.verse: I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob? He is not the God of the dead but of the living!

33.verse: And when the throng heard it, they were astonished and filled with [glad] amazement at His teaching.

34.verse: Now when the Pharisees heard that He had silenced (muzzled) the Sadducees, they gathered together.

35.verse: And one of their number, a lawyer, asked Him a question to test Him.

36.verse: Teacher, which kind of commandment is great and important (the principal kind) in the Law? [Some commandments are light--which are heavy?]

37.verse: And He replied to him, You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind (intellect).

38.verse: This is the great (most important, principal) and first commandment.

39.verse: And a second is like it: You shall love your neighbor as [you do] yourself.

40.verse: These two commandments sum up and upon them depend all the Law and the Prophets.

41.verse: Now while the Pharisees were still assembled there, Jesus asked them a question,

42.verse: Saying, What do you think of the Christ? Whose Son is He? They said to Him, The Son of David.

43.verse: He said to them, How is it then that David, under the influence of the [Holy] Spirit, calls Him Lord, saying,

44.verse: The Lord said to My Lord, Sit at My right hand until I put Your enemies under Your feet?

45.verse: If then David thus calls Him Lord, how is He his Son?

46.verse: And no one was able to answer Him a word, nor from that day did anyone venture or dare to question Him.

1.verse: THEN JESUS said to the multitudes and to His disciples,

2.verse: The scribes and Pharisees sit on Moses' seat [of authority].

3.verse: So observe and practice all they tell you; but do not do what they do, for they preach, but do not practice.

4.verse: They tie up heavy loads, hard to bear, and place them on men's shoulders, but they themselves will not lift a finger to help bear them.

5.verse: They do all their works to be seen of men; for they make wide their phylacteries (small cases enclosing certain Scripture passages, worn during prayer on the left arm and forehead) and make long their fringes [worn by all male Israelites, according to the command].

6.verse: And they take pleasure in and [thus] love the place of honor at feasts and the best seats in the synagogues,

7.verse: And to be greeted with honor in the marketplaces and to have people call them rabbi.

8.verse: But you are not to be called rabbi (teacher), for you have one Teacher and you are all brothers.

9.verse: And do not call anyone [in the church] on earth father, for you have one Father, Who is in heaven.

10.verse: And you must not be called masters (leaders), for you have one Master (Leader), the Christ.

11.verse: He who is greatest among you shall be your servant.

12.verse: Whoever exalts himself [with haughtiness and empty pride] shall be humbled (brought low), and whoever humbles himself [whoever has a modest opinion of himself and behaves accordingly] shall be raised to honor.

13.verse: But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, pretenders (hypocrites)! For you shut the kingdom of heaven in men's faces; for you neither enter yourselves, nor do you allow those who are about to go in to do so.

14.verse: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, pretenders (hypocrites)! For you swallow up widows' houses and for a pretense to cover it up make long prayers; therefore you will receive the greater condemnation and the heavier sentence.

15.verse: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, pretenders (hypocrites)! For you travel over sea and land to make a single proselyte, and when he becomes one [a proselyte], you make him doubly as much a child of hell (Gehenna) as you are.

16.verse: Woe to you, blind guides, who say, If anyone swears by the sanctuary of the temple, it is nothing; but if anyone swears by the gold of the sanctuary, he is a debtor [bound by his oath].

17.verse: You blind fools! For which is greater: the gold, or the sanctuary of the temple that has made the gold sacred?

18.verse: You say too, Whoever swears by the altar is not duty bound; but whoever swears by the offering on the altar, his oath is binding.

19.verse: You blind men! Which is greater: the gift, or the altar which makes the gift sacred?

20.verse: So whoever swears by the altar swears by it and by everything on it.

21.verse: And he who swears by the sanctuary of the temple swears by it and by Him Who dwells in it. [I Kings 8:13; Ps. 26:8.]

22.verse: And whoever swears by heaven swears by the throne of God and by Him Who sits upon it.

23.verse: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, pretenders (hypocrites)! For you give a tenth of your mint and dill and cummin, and have neglected and omitted the weightier (more important) matters of the Law--right and justice and mercy and fidelity. These you ought [particularly] to have done, without neglecting the others.

24.verse: You blind guides, filtering out a gnat and gulping down a camel!

25.verse: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, pretenders (hypocrites)! For you clean the outside of the cup and of the plate, but within they are full of extortion (prey, spoil, plunder) and grasping self-indulgence.

26.verse: You blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup and of the plate, so that the outside may be clean also.

27.verse: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, pretenders (hypocrites)! For you are like tombs that have been whitewashed, which look beautiful on the outside but inside are full of dead men's bones and everything impure.

28.verse: Just so, you also outwardly seem to people to be just and upright but inside you are full of pretense and lawlessness and iniquity.

29.verse: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, pretenders (hypocrites)! For you build tombs for the prophets and decorate the monuments of the righteous,

30.verse: Saying, If we had lived in the days of our forefathers, we would not have aided them in shedding the blood of the prophets.

31.verse: Thus you are testifying against yourselves that you are the descendants of those who murdered the prophets.

32.verse: Fill up, then, the measure of your fathers' sins to the brim [so that nothing may be wanting to a full measure].

33.verse: You serpents! You spawn of vipers! How can you escape the penalty to be suffered in hell (Gehenna)?

34.verse: Because of this, take notice: I am sending you prophets and wise men (interpreters and teachers) and scribes (men learned in the Mosaic Law and the Prophets); some of them you will kill, even crucify, and some you will flog in your synagogues and pursue and persecute from town to town,

35.verse: So that upon your heads may come all the blood of the righteous (those who correspond to the divine standard of right) shed on earth, from the blood of the righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Barachiah, whom you murdered between the sanctuary and the altar [of burnt offering].

36.verse: Truly I declare to you, all these [evil, calamitous times] will come upon this generation. [II Chron. 36:15, 16.]

37.verse: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, murdering the prophets and stoning those who are sent to you! How often would I have gathered your children together as a mother fowl gathers her brood under her wings, and you refused!

38.verse: Behold, your house is forsaken and desolate (abandoned and left destitute of God's help). [I Kings 9:7; Jer. 22:5.]

39.verse: For I declare to you, you will not see Me again until you say, Blessed (magnified in worship, adored, and exalted) is He Who comes in the name of the Lord!

1.verse: JESUS DEPARTED from the temple area and was going on His way when His disciples came up to Him to call His attention to the buildings of the temple and point them out to Him.

2.verse: But He answered them, Do you see all these? Truly I tell you, there will not be left here one stone upon another that will not be thrown down.

3.verse: While He was seated on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to Him privately and said, Tell us, when will this take place, and what will be the sign of Your coming and of the end (the completion, the consummation) of the age?

4.verse: Jesus answered them, Be careful that no one misleads you [deceiving you and leading you into error].

5.verse: For many will come in (on the strength of) My name [appropriating the name which belongs to Me], saying, I am the Christ (the Messiah), and they will lead many astray.

6.verse: And you will hear of wars and rumors of wars; see that you are not frightened or troubled, for this must take place, but the end is not yet.

7.verse: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom, and there will be famines and earthquakes in place after place;

8.verse: All this is but the beginning [the early pains] of the birth pangs [of the intolerable anguish].

9.verse: Then they will hand you over to suffer affliction and tribulation and put you to death, and you will be hated by all nations for My name's sake.

10.verse: And then many will be offended and repelled and will begin to distrust and desert [Him Whom they ought to trust and obey] and will stumble and fall away and betray one another and pursue one another with hatred.

11.verse: And many false prophets will rise up and deceive and lead many into error.

12.verse: And the love of the great body of people will grow cold because of the multiplied lawlessness and iniquity,

13.verse: But he who endures to the end will be saved.

14.verse: And this good news of the kingdom (the Gospel) will be preached throughout the whole world as a testimony to all the nations, and then will come the end.

15.verse: So when you see the appalling sacrilege [the abomination that astonishes and makes desolate], spoken of by the prophet Daniel, standing in the Holy Place--let the reader take notice and ponder and consider and heed [this]--

16.verse: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains;

17.verse: Let him who is on the housetop not come down and go into the house to take anything;

18.verse: And let him who is in the field not turn back to get his overcoat.

19.verse: And alas for the women who are pregnant and for those who have nursing babies in those days!

20.verse: Pray that your flight may not be in winter or on a Sabbath.

21.verse: For then there will be great tribulation (affliction, distress, and oppression) such as has not been from the beginning of the world until now--no, and never will be [again].

22.verse: And if those days had not been shortened, no human being would endure and survive, but for the sake of the elect (God's chosen ones) those days will be shortened.

23.verse: If anyone says to you then, Behold, here is the Christ (the Messiah)! or, There He is!--do not believe it.

24.verse: For false Christs and false prophets will arise, and they will show great signs and wonders so as to deceive and lead astray, if possible, even the elect (God's chosen ones).

25.verse: See, I have warned you beforehand.

26.verse: So if they say to you, Behold, He is in the wilderness (desert)--do not go out there; if they tell you, Behold, He is in the secret places or inner rooms--do not believe it.

27.verse: For just as the lightning flashes from the east and shines and is seen as far as the west, so will the coming of the Son of Man be.

28.verse: Wherever there is a fallen body (a corpse), there the vultures (or eagles) will flock together.

29.verse: Immediately after the tribulation of those days the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not shed its light, and the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.

30.verse: Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky, and then all the tribes of the earth will mourn and beat their breasts and lament in anguish, and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory [in brilliancy and splendor].

31.verse: And He will send out His angels with a loud trumpet call, and they will gather His elect (His chosen ones) from the four winds, [even] from one end of the universe to the other.

32.verse: From the fig tree learn this lesson: as soon as its young shoots become soft and tender and it puts out its leaves, you know of a surety that summer is near.

33.verse: So also when you see these signs, all taken together, coming to pass, you may know of a surety that He is near, at the very doors.

34.verse: Truly I tell you, this generation (the whole multitude of people living at the same time, in a definite, given period) will not pass away till all these things taken together take place.

35.verse: Sky and earth will pass away, but My words will not pass away.

36.verse: But of that [exact] day and hour no one knows, not even the angels of heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.

37.verse: As were the days of Noah, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

38.verse: For just as in those days before the flood they were eating and drinking, [men] marrying and [women] being given in marriage, until the [very] day when Noah went into the ark,

39.verse: And they did not know or understand until the flood came and swept them all away--so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

40.verse: At that time two men will be in the field; one will be taken and one will be left.

41.verse: Two women will be grinding at the hand mill; one will be taken and one will be left.

42.verse: Watch therefore [give strict attention, be cautious and active], for you do not know in what kind of a day [whether a near or remote one] your Lord is coming.

43.verse: But understand this: had the householder known in what [part of the night, whether in a night or a morning] watch the thief was coming, he would have watched and would not have allowed his house to be undermined and broken into.

44.verse: You also must be ready therefore, for the Son of Man is coming at an hour when you do not expect Him.

45.verse: Who then is the faithful, thoughtful, and wise servant, whom his master has put in charge of his household to give to the others the food and supplies at the proper time?

46.verse: Blessed (happy, fortunate, and to be envied) is that servant whom, when his master comes, he will find so doing.

47.verse: I solemnly declare to you, he will set him over all his possessions.

48.verse: But if that servant is wicked and says to himself, My master is delayed and is going to be gone a long time,

49.verse: And begins to beat his fellow servants and to eat and drink with the drunken,

50.verse: The master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour of which he is not aware,

51.verse: And will punish him [cut him up by scourging] and put him with the pretenders (hypocrites); there will be weeping and grinding of teeth.

1.verse: THEN THE kingdom of heaven shall be likened to ten virgins who took their lamps and went to meet the bridegroom.

2.verse: Five of them were foolish (thoughtless, without forethought) and five were wise (sensible, intelligent, and prudent).

3.verse: For when the foolish took their lamps, they did not take any [extra] oil with them;

4.verse: But the wise took flasks of oil along with them [also] with their lamps.

5.verse: While the bridegroom lingered and was slow in coming, they all began nodding their heads, and they fell asleep.

6.verse: But at midnight there was a shout, Behold, the bridegroom! Go out to meet him!

7.verse: Then all those virgins got up and put their own lamps in order.

8.verse: And the foolish said to the wise, Give us some of your oil, for our lamps are going out.

9.verse: But the wise replied, There will not be enough for us and for you; go instead to the dealers and buy for yourselves.

10.verse: But while they were going away to buy, the bridegroom came, and those who were prepared went in with him to the marriage feast; and the door was shut.

11.verse: Later the other virgins also came and said, Lord, Lord, open [the door] to us!

12.verse: But He replied, I solemnly declare to you, I do not know you [I am not acquainted with you].

13.verse: Watch therefore [give strict attention and be cautious and active], for you know neither the day nor the hour when the Son of Man will come.

14.verse: For it is like a man who was about to take a long journey, and he called his servants together and entrusted them with his property.

15.verse: To one he gave five talents [probably about $5,000], to another two, to another one--to each in proportion to his own personal ability. Then he departed and left the country.

16.verse: He who had received the five talents went at once and traded with them, and he gained five talents more.

17.verse: And likewise he who had received the two talents--he also gained two talents more.

18.verse: But he who had received the one talent went and dug a hole in the ground and hid his master's money.

19.verse: Now after a long time the master of those servants returned and settled accounts with them.

20.verse: And he who had received the five talents came and brought him five more, saying, Master, you entrusted to me five talents; see, here I have gained five talents more.

21.verse: His master said to him, Well done, you upright (honorable, admirable) and faithful servant! You have been faithful and trustworthy over a little; I will put you in charge of much. Enter into and share the joy (the delight, the blessedness) which your master enjoys.

22.verse: And he also who had the two talents came forward, saying, Master, you entrusted two talents to me; here I have gained two talents more.

23.verse: His master said to him, Well done, you upright (honorable, admirable) and faithful servant! You have been faithful and trustworthy over a little; I will put you in charge of much. Enter into and share the joy (the delight, the blessedness) which your master enjoys.

24.verse: He who had received one talent also came forward, saying, Master, I knew you to be a harsh and hard man, reaping where you did not sow, and gathering where you had not winnowed [the grain].

25.verse: So I was afraid, and I went and hid your talent in the ground. Here you have what is your own.

26.verse: But his master answered him, You wicked and lazy and idle servant! Did you indeed know that I reap where I have not sowed and gather [grain] where I have not winnowed?

27.verse: Then you should have invested my money with the bankers, and at my coming I would have received what was my own with interest.

28.verse: So take the talent away from him and give it to the one who has the ten talents.

29.verse: For to everyone who has will more be given, and he will be furnished richly so that he will have an abundance; but from the one who does not have, even what he does have will be taken away.

30.verse: And throw the good-for-nothing servant into the outer darkness; there will be weeping and grinding of teeth.

31.verse: When the Son of Man comes in His glory (His majesty and splendor), and all the holy angels with Him, then He will sit on the throne of His glory.

32.verse: All nations will be gathered before Him, and He will separate them [the people] from one another as a shepherd separates his sheep from the goats;

33.verse: And He will cause the sheep to stand at His right hand, but the goats at His left.

34.verse: Then the King will say to those at His right hand, Come, you blessed of My Father [you favored of God and appointed to eternal salvation], inherit (receive as your own) the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.

35.verse: For I was hungry and you gave Me food, I was thirsty and you gave Me something to drink, I was a stranger and you brought Me together with yourselves and welcomed and entertained and lodged Me,

36.verse: I was naked and you clothed Me, I was sick and you visited Me with help and ministering care, I was in prison and you came to see Me.

37.verse: Then the just and upright will answer Him, Lord, when did we see You hungry and gave You food, or thirsty and gave You something to drink?

38.verse: And when did we see You a stranger and welcomed and entertained You, or naked and clothed You?

39.verse: And when did we see You sick or in prison and came to visit You?

40.verse: And the King will reply to them, Truly I tell you, in so far as you did it for one of the least [in the estimation of men] of these My brethren, you did it for Me.

41.verse: Then He will say to those at His left hand, Begone from Me, you cursed, into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels!

42.verse: For I was hungry and you gave Me no food, I was thirsty and you gave Me nothing to drink,

43.verse: I was a stranger and you did not welcome Me and entertain Me, I was naked and you did not clothe Me, I was sick and in prison and you did not visit Me with help and ministering care.

44.verse: Then they also [in their turn] will answer, Lord, when did we see You hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison, and did not minister to You?

45.verse: And He will reply to them, Solemnly I declare to you, in so far as you failed to do it for the least [in the estimation of men] of these, you failed to do it for Me.

46.verse: Then they will go away into eternal punishment, but those who are just and upright and in right standing with God into eternal life.

1.verse: WHEN JESUS had ended this discourse, He said to His disciples,

2.verse: You know that the Passover is in two days--and the Son of Man will be delivered up treacherously to be crucified.

3.verse: Then the chief priests and the elders of the people gathered in the [open] court of the palace of the high priest, whose name was Caiaphas,

4.verse: And consulted together in order to arrest Jesus by stratagem secretly and put Him to death.

5.verse: But they said, It must not be during the Feast, for fear that there will be a riot among the people.

6.verse: Now when Jesus came back to Bethany and was in the house of Simon the leper,

7.verse: A woman came up to Him with an alabaster flask of very precious perfume, and she poured it on His head as He reclined at table.

8.verse: And when the disciples saw it, they were indignant, saying, For what purpose is all this waste?

9.verse: For this perfume might have been sold for a large sum and the money given to the poor.

10.verse: But Jesus, fully aware of this, said to them, Why do you bother the woman? She has done a noble (praiseworthy and beautiful) thing to Me.

11.verse: For you always have the poor among you, but you will not always have Me.

12.verse: In pouring this perfume on My body she has done something to prepare Me for My burial.

13.verse: Truly I tell you, wherever this good news (the Gospel) is preached in the whole world, what this woman has done will be told also, in memory of her.

14.verse: Then one of the Twelve [apostles], who was called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests

15.verse: And said, What are you willing to give me if I hand Him over to you? And they weighed out for and paid to him thirty pieces of silver [about twenty-one dollars and sixty cents].

16.verse: And from that moment he sought a fitting opportunity to betray Him.

17.verse: Now on the first day of Unleavened Bread [Passover week], the disciples came to Jesus and said to Him, Where do You wish us to prepare for You to eat the Passover supper?

18.verse: He said, Go into the city to a certain man and say to him, The Master says: My time is near; I will keep the Passover at your house with My disciples.

19.verse: And accordingly the disciples did as Jesus had directed them, and they made ready the Passover supper.

20.verse: When it was evening, He was reclining at table with the twelve disciples.

21.verse: And as they were eating, He said, Solemnly I say to you, one of you will betray Me!

22.verse: They were exceedingly pained and distressed and deeply hurt and sorrowful and began to say to Him one after another, Surely it cannot be I, Lord, can it?

23.verse: He replied, He who has [just] dipped his hand in the same dish with Me will betray Me!

24.verse: The Son of Man is going just as it is written of Him; but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been better (more profitable and wholesome) for that man if he had never been born!

25.verse: Judas, the betrayer, said, Surely it is not I, is it, Master? He said to him, You have stated [the fact].

26.verse: Now as they were eating, Jesus took bread and, praising God, gave thanks and asked Him to bless it to their use, and when He had broken it, He gave it to the disciples and said, Take, eat; this is My body.

27.verse: And He took a cup, and when He had given thanks, He gave it to them, saying, Drink of it, all of you;

28.verse: For this is My blood of the new covenant, which [ratifies the agreement and] is being poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.

29.verse: I say to you, I shall not drink again of this fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it with you new and of superior quality in My Father's kingdom.

30.verse: And when they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

31.verse: Then Jesus said to them, You will all be offended and stumble and fall away because of Me this night [distrusting and deserting Me], for it is written, I will strike the Shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.

32.verse: But after I am raised up [to life again], I will go ahead of you to Galilee.

33.verse: Peter declared to Him, Though they all are offended and stumble and fall away because of You [and distrust and desert You], I will never do so.

34.verse: Jesus said to him, Solemnly I declare to you, this very night, before a single rooster crows, you will deny and disown Me three times.

35.verse: Peter said to Him, Even if I must die with You, I will not deny or disown You! And all the disciples said the same thing.

36.verse: Then Jesus went with them to a place called Gethsemane, and He told His disciples, Sit down here while I go over yonder and pray.

37.verse: And taking with Him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, He began to show grief and distress of mind and was deeply depressed.

38.verse: Then He said to them, My soul is very sad and deeply grieved, so that I am almost dying of sorrow. Stay here and keep awake and keep watch with Me.

39.verse: And going a little farther, He threw Himself upon the ground on His face and prayed saying, My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass away from Me; nevertheless, not what I will [not what I desire], but as You will and desire.

40.verse: And He came to the disciples and found them sleeping, and He said to Peter, What! Are you so utterly unable to stay awake and keep watch with Me for one hour?

41.verse: All of you must keep awake (give strict attention, be cautious and active) and watch and pray, that you may not come into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.

42.verse: Again a second time He went away and prayed, My Father, if this cannot pass by unless I drink it, Your will be done.

43.verse: And again He came and found them sleeping, for their eyes were weighed down with sleep.

44.verse: So, leaving them again, He went away and prayed for the third time, using the same words.

45.verse: Then He returned to the disciples and said to them, Are you still sleeping and taking your rest? Behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of especially wicked sinners [whose way or nature it is to act in opposition to God].

46.verse: Get up, let us be going! See, My betrayer is at hand!

47.verse: As He was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve [apostles], came up, and with him a great crowd with swords and clubs, from the chief priests and elders of the people.

48.verse: Now the betrayer had given them a sign, saying, The One I shall kiss is the Man; seize Him.

49.verse: And he came up to Jesus at once and said, Hail (greetings, good health to You, long life to You), Master! And he embraced Him and kissed Him with [pretended] warmth and devotion.

50.verse: Jesus said to him, Friend, for what are you here? Then they came up and laid hands on Jesus and arrested Him.

51.verse: And behold, one of those who were with Jesus reached out his hand and drew his sword and, striking the body servant of the high priest, cut off his ear.

52.verse: Then Jesus said to him, Put your sword back into its place, for all who draw the sword will die by the sword.

53.verse: Do you suppose that I cannot appeal to My Father, and He will immediately provide Me with more than twelve legions [more than 80,000] of angels?

54.verse: But how then would the Scriptures be fulfilled, that it must come about this way?

55.verse: At that moment Jesus said to the crowds, Have you come out with swords and clubs as [you would] against a robber to capture Me? Day after day I was accustomed to sit in the porches and courts of the temple teaching, and you did not arrest Me.

56.verse: But all this has taken place in order that the Scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled. Then all the disciples deserted Him and, fleeing, escaped.

57.verse: But those who had seized Jesus took Him away to Caiaphas, the high priest, where the scribes and the elders had assembled.

58.verse: But Peter followed Him at a distance, as far as the courtyard of the high priest's home; he even went inside and sat with the guards to see the end.

59.verse: Now the chief priests and the whole council (the Sanhedrin) sought to get false witnesses to testify against Jesus, so that they might put Him to death;

60.verse: But they found none, though many witnesses came forward [to testify]. At last two men came forward

61.verse: And testified, This Fellow said, I am able to tear down the sanctuary of the temple of God and to build it up again in three days.

62.verse: And the high priest stood up and said, Have You no answer to make? What about this that these men testify against You?

63.verse: But Jesus kept silent. And the high priest said to Him, I call upon you to swear by the living God, and tell us whether you are the Christ, the Son of God.

64.verse: Jesus said to him, You have stated [the fact]. More than that, I tell you: You will in the future see the Son of Man seated at the right hand of the Almighty and coming on the clouds of the sky.

65.verse: Then the high priest tore his clothes and exclaimed, He has uttered blasphemy! What need have we of further evidence? You have now heard His blasphemy.

66.verse: What do you think now? They answered, He deserves to be put to death.

67.verse: Then they spat in His face and struck Him with their fists; and some slapped Him in the face,

68.verse: Saying, Prophesy to us, You Christ (the Messiah)! Who was it that struck You?

69.verse: Now Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard, and one maid came up to him and said, You were also with Jesus the Galilean!

70.verse: But he denied it falsely before them all, saying, I do not know what you mean.

71.verse: And when he had gone out to the porch, another maid saw him, and she said to the bystanders, This fellow was with Jesus the Nazarene!

72.verse: And again he denied it and disowned Him with an oath, saying, I do not know the Man!

73.verse: After a little while, the bystanders came up and said to Peter, You certainly are one of them too, for even your accent betrays you.

74.verse: Then Peter began to invoke a curse on himself and to swear, I do not even know the Man! And at that moment a rooster crowed.

75.verse: And Peter remembered Jesus' words, when He had said, Before a single rooster crows, you will deny and disown Me three times. And he went outside and wept bitterly.

1.verse: WHEN IT was morning, all the chief priests and the elders of the people held a consultation against Jesus to put Him to death;

2.verse: And they bound Him and led Him away and handed Him over to Pilate the governor.

3.verse: When Judas, His betrayer, saw that [Jesus] was condemned, [Judas was afflicted in mind and troubled for his former folly; and] with remorse [with little more than a selfish dread of the consequences] he brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and the elders,

4.verse: Saying, I have sinned in betraying innocent blood. They replied, What is that to us? See to that yourself.

5.verse: And casting the pieces of silver [forward] into the [Holy Place of the sanctuary of the] temple, he departed; and he went off and hanged himself.

6.verse: But the chief priests, picking up the pieces of silver, said, It is not legal to put these in the [consecrated] treasury, for it is the price of blood.

7.verse: So after consultation they bought with them [the pieces of silver] the potter's field [as a place] in which to bury strangers.

8.verse: Therefore that piece of ground has been called the Field of Blood to the present day.

9.verse: Then were fulfilled the words spoken by Jeremiah the prophet when he said, And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of Him on Whom a price had been set by some of the sons of Israel,

10.verse: And they gave them for the potter's field, as the Lord directed me.

11.verse: Now Jesus stood before the governor [Pilate], and the governor asked Him, Are you the King of the Jews? Jesus said to him, You have stated [the fact].

12.verse: But when the charges were made against Him by the chief priests and elders, He made no answer.

13.verse: Then Pilate said to Him, Do You not hear how many and how serious are the things they are testifying against You?

14.verse: But He made no reply to him, not even to a single accusation, so that the governor marveled greatly.

15.verse: Now at the Feast [of the Passover] the governor was in the habit of setting free for the people any one prisoner whom they chose.

16.verse: And at that time they had a notorious prisoner whose name was Barabbas.

17.verse: So when they had assembled for this purpose, Pilate said to them, Whom do you want me to set free for you, Barabbas, or Jesus Who is called Christ?

18.verse: For he knew that it was because of envy that they had handed Him over to him.

19.verse: Also, while he was seated on the judgment bench, his wife sent him a message, saying, Have nothing to do with that just and upright Man, for I have had a painful experience today in a dream because of Him.

20.verse: But the chief priests and the elders prevailed on the people to ask for Barabbas, and put Jesus to death.

21.verse: Again the governor said to them, Which of the two do you wish me to release for you? And they said, Barabbas!

22.verse: Pilate said to them, Then what shall I do with Jesus Who is called Christ?

23.verse: They all replied, Let Him be crucified! And he said, Why? What has He done that is evil? But they shouted all the louder, Let Him be crucified!

24.verse: So when Pilate saw that he was getting nowhere, but rather that a riot was about to break out, he took water and washed his hands in the presence of the crowd, saying, I am not guilty of nor responsible for this righteous Man's blood; see to it yourselves.

25.verse: And all the people answered, Let His blood be on us and on our children!

26.verse: So he set free for them Barabbas; and he [had] Jesus whipped, and delivered Him up to be crucified.

27.verse: Then the governor's soldiers took Jesus into the palace, and they gathered the whole battalion about Him.

28.verse: And they stripped off His clothes and put a scarlet robe (garment of dignity and office worn by Roman officers of rank) upon Him,

29.verse: And, weaving a crown of thorns, they put it on His head and put a reed (staff) in His right hand. And kneeling before Him, they made sport of Him, saying, Hail (greetings, good health to You, long life to You), King of the Jews!

30.verse: And they spat on Him, and took the reed (staff) and struck Him on the head.

31.verse: And when they finished making sport of Him, they stripped Him of the robe and put His own garments on Him and led Him away to be crucified.

32.verse: As they were marching forth, they came upon a man of Cyrene named Simon; this man they forced to carry the cross of Jesus.

33.verse: And when they came to a place called Golgotha [Latin: Calvary], which means The Place of a Skull,

34.verse: They offered Him wine mingled with gall to drink; but when He tasted it, He refused to drink it.

35.verse: And when they had crucified Him, they divided and distributed His garments [among them] by casting lots so that the prophet's saying was fulfilled, They parted My garments among them and over My apparel they cast lots.

36.verse: Then they sat down there and kept watch over Him.

37.verse: And over His head they put the accusation against Him (the cause of His death), which read, This is Jesus, the King of the Jews.

38.verse: At the same time two robbers were crucified with Him, one on the right hand and one on the left.

39.verse: And those who passed by spoke reproachfully and abusively and jeered at Him, wagging their heads,

40.verse: And they said, You Who would tear down the sanctuary of the temple and rebuild it in three days, rescue Yourself from death. If You are the Son of God, come down from the cross.

41.verse: In the same way the chief priests, with the scribes and elders, made sport of Him, saying,

42.verse: He rescued others from death; Himself He cannot rescue from death. He is the King of Israel? Let Him come down from the cross now, and we will believe in and acknowledge and cleave to Him.

43.verse: He trusts in God; let God deliver Him now if He cares for Him and will have Him, for He said, I am the Son of God.

44.verse: And the robbers who were crucified with Him also abused and reproached and made sport of Him in the same way.

45.verse: Now from the sixth hour (noon) there was darkness over all the land until the ninth hour (three o'clock).

46.verse: And about the ninth hour (three o'clock) Jesus cried with a loud voice, Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?--that is, My God, My God, why have You abandoned Me [leaving Me helpless, forsaking and failing Me in My need]?

47.verse: And some of the bystanders, when they heard it, said, This Man is calling for Elijah!

48.verse: And one of them immediately ran and took a sponge, soaked it with vinegar (a sour wine), and put it on a reed (staff), and was about to give it to Him to drink.

49.verse: But the others said, Wait! Let us see whether Elijah will come to save Him from death.

50.verse: And Jesus cried again with a loud voice and gave up His spirit.

51.verse: And at once the curtain of the sanctuary of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom; the earth shook and the rocks were split.

52.verse: The tombs were opened and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep in death were raised [to life];

53.verse: And coming out of the tombs after His resurrection, they went into the holy city and appeared to many people.

54.verse: When the centurion and those who were with him keeping watch over Jesus observed the earthquake and all that was happening, they were terribly frightened and filled with awe, and said, Truly this was God's Son!

55.verse: There were also numerous women there, looking on from a distance, who were of those who had accompanied Jesus from Galilee, ministering to Him.

56.verse: Among them were Mary of Magdala, and Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of Zebedee's sons.

57.verse: When it was evening, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who also was a disciple of Jesus.

58.verse: He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus, and Pilate ordered that it be given to him.

59.verse: And Joseph took the body and rolled it up in a clean linen cloth used for swathing dead bodies

60.verse: And laid it in his own fresh (undefiled) tomb, which he had hewn in the rock; and he rolled a big boulder over the door of the tomb and went away.

61.verse: And Mary of Magdala and the other Mary kept sitting there opposite the tomb.

62.verse: The next day, that is, the day after the day of Preparation [for the Sabbath], the chief priests and the Pharisees assembled before Pilate

63.verse: And said, Sir, we have just remembered how that vagabond Imposter said while He was still alive, After three days I will rise again.

64.verse: Therefore give an order to have the tomb made secure and safeguarded until the third day, for fear that His disciples will come and steal Him away and tell the people that He has risen from the dead, and the last deception and fraud will be worse than the first.

65.verse: Pilate said to them, You have a guard [of soldiers; take them and] go, make it as secure as you can.

66.verse: So they went off and made the tomb secure by sealing the boulder, a guard of soldiers being with them and remaining to watch.

1.verse: NOW AFTER the Sabbath, near dawn of the first day of the week, Mary of Magdala and the other Mary went to take a look at the tomb.

2.verse: And behold, there was a great earthquake, for an angel of the Lord descended from heaven and came and rolled the boulder back and sat upon it.

3.verse: His appearance was like lightning, and his garments as white as snow.

4.verse: And those keeping guard were so frightened at the sight of him that they were agitated and they trembled and became like dead men.

5.verse: But the angel said to the women, Do not be alarmed and frightened, for I know that you are looking for Jesus, Who was crucified.

6.verse: He is not here; He has risen, as He said [He would do]. Come, see the place where He lay.

7.verse: Then go quickly and tell His disciples, He has risen from the dead, and behold, He is going before you to Galilee; there you will see Him. Behold, I have told you.

8.verse: So they left the tomb hastily with fear and great joy and ran to tell the disciples.

9.verse: And as they went, behold, Jesus met them and said, Hail (greetings)! And they went up to Him and clasped His feet and worshiped Him.

10.verse: Then Jesus said to them, Do not be alarmed and afraid; go and tell My brethren to go into Galilee, and there they will see Me.

11.verse: While they were on their way, behold, some of the guards went into the city and reported to the chief priests everything that had occurred.

12.verse: And when they [the chief priests] had gathered with the elders and had consulted together, they gave a sufficient sum of money to the soldiers,

13.verse: And said, Tell people, His disciples came at night and stole Him away while we were sleeping.

14.verse: And if the governor hears of it, we will appease him and make you safe and free from trouble and care.

15.verse: So they took the money and did as they were instructed; and this story has been current among the Jews to the present day.

16.verse: Now the eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain to which Jesus had directed and made appointment with them.

17.verse: And when they saw Him, they fell down and worshiped Him; but some doubted.

18.verse: Jesus approached and, breaking the silence, said to them, All authority (all power of rule) in heaven and on earth has been given to Me.

19.verse: Go then and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them into the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,

20.verse: Teaching them to observe everything that I have commanded you, and behold, I am with you all the days (perpetually, uniformly, and on every occasion), to the [very] close and consummation of the age. Amen (so let it be).
